title: HCl equil mechanism - value of enthalpy change

content.description:
H2(g) + Cl2(g) ⇄ 2 HCl(g)      Kp = 2 × 1030 at 298 K

HCl(g) can be synthesized from H2(g) and Cl2(g) as represented above. A student studying the kinetics of the reaction proposes the following mechanism

Step 1: Cl2(g) → 2 Cl(g)                             (slow)        ∆H° = 242 kJ/molrxn

Step 2: H2(g) + Cl(g) → HCl(g) + H(g)       (fast)         ∆H° = 4 kJ/molrxn

Step 3: H(g) + Cl(g) → HCl(g)                   (fast)        ∆H° = -432 kJ/molrxn
content.question: What is the value of the enthalpy change per mole of HCl(g) produced?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
